main.name: Udo Schlegel
main.description: I am interested in artificial intelligence and security, especially deep learning and cybersecurity, but also predictive policing and machine learning in general. My current research revolves around a visualized understanding of deep neural networks for time series.
main.bio: Hi, I am Udo. I work as a research associate in visual analytics. My research interest evolves around artificial intelligence and the unlimited possibilities it incorporates. Discussing the technical and ethical limitations around AI is another aspect I like. This includes what AI can learn from human behavior and how we could model human behavior using AI models.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: Focus on explainable AI and visual explainable AI for time series
Focus on Machine Learning and especially Deep Learning
Focus on Machine Learning and Visualization

work.title: PhD Candidate & Research Associate
work.description: I was lucky to get an offer not many people get after their master. I could either go the industry and start a career as a data scientist or software engineer or I could stay at the university doing what I am interested in: machine learning, visual data analysis, and research.

work.title: Machine Learning Consultant
work.description: During a short transition phase before my PhD position, I worked as a freelance machine learning consultant with Steinbeis and Siemens CT to develop a system for explainable AI on time series classification tasks.

work.title: Student Research Assistant
work.description: To work primarily on industry projects, I worked for several months for Steinbeis in cooperation with the LKA NRW and Siemens CT. There I was part of a team working on predictive policing and predictive maintenance time series analysis.

work.title: Student Research Assistant
work.description: During my time as a student research assistant, I started with the maintenance and support of the web pages of the department and projects of Prof. Dr. Daniel Keim. However, I was eager to extend my knowledge of data analysis and project research. I was part of various projects ranging from energy network analysis to predictive policing to 3D point cloud analysis. Notably, the predictive policing caught me and guided me to my master thesis about crime forecasting using deep learning.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
